001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.polynomials.PolynomialSplineFunction;
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008/**
009 * Local regression (LOESS) interpolator for one-dimensional data.
010 *
011 * <p>
012 * Main purpose: provide a convenient, immutable wrapper around Apache Commons
013 * Math's LOESS implementation that fulfils the {@link Interpolator} contract.
014 * The implementation fits a smooth piecewise polynomial to the supplied (x,y)
015 * data and exposes interpolation and derivative evaluation.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * Key features:
019 * <ul>
020 * <li>Immutable configuration via Immutables builder;</li>
021 * <li>Automatic bandwidth selection based on sample size;</li>
022 * <li>Provides both interpolated value and first derivative evaluation.</li>
023 * </ul>
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Downstream uses: consumed wherever a smooth local regression is required for
027 * numeric curves, for example in smoothing empirical profiles before fitting or
028 * calibration routines (see {@link EmpiricalDistribution}).
029 *
030 * @author Rob Challen
031 */
032@Value.Immutable
033public interface LoessInterpolator extends Interpolator {
034
035        /**
036         * Construct a LOESS interpolator from the supplied data arrays.
037         *
038         * @param x the x-coordinates (must be strictly increasing)
039         * @param y the y-coordinates (same length as {@code x})
040         * @return an immutable {@link LoessInterpolator} instance
041         * @see Interpolator#checkInputs(double[], double[])
042         */
043        public static LoessInterpolator createLoessInterpolator(
044                        double[] x, double[] y
045        ) {
046                Interpolator.checkInputs(x, y);
047                return ImmutableLoessInterpolator.builder().setX(x).setY(y).build();
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Compute the first derivative of the fitted LOESS spline at the point
052         * supplied. Values outside the fitted support are clamped to the support
053         * boundaries before evaluation.
054         *
055         * @param x the point at which to evaluate the derivative
056         * @return the first derivative of the interpolant at {@code x}
057         */
058        @Override
059        default double differential(double x) {
060                x = Interpolator.squish(this.getMinSupport(), x, this.getMaxSupport());
061                return this.getLoess().derivative().value(x);
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Returns an evaluated polynomial spline function produced by the LOESS
066         * algorithm.
067         *
068         * <p>
069         * Clients may use the returned {@link PolynomialSplineFunction} for advanced
070         * evaluation, for example to obtain higher order derivatives.
071         *
072         * @return the fitted {@link PolynomialSplineFunction}
073         */
074        @Value.Lazy
075        default PolynomialSplineFunction getLoess() {
076                int n = this.getX().length;
077                double bw = 4.0 / n;
078                org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.interpolation.LoessInterpolator tmp = new org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.interpolation.LoessInterpolator(
079                                bw,
080                                org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.interpolation.LoessInterpolator.DEFAULT_ROBUSTNESS_ITERS
081                );
082                return tmp.interpolate(this.getX(), this.getY());
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * The maximum x value in the support of the interpolator.
087         *
088         * @return the maximum x value (domain upper bound)
089         */
090        @Value.Derived
091        default double getMaxSupport() {
092                return Arrays.stream(this.getX()).max().getAsDouble();
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * The minimum x value in the support of the interpolator.
097         *
098         * @return the minimum x value (domain lower bound)
099         */
100        @Value.Derived
101        default double getMinSupport() {
102                return Arrays.stream(this.getX()).min().getAsDouble();
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * The independent coordinate values used to fit the LOESS model.
107         *
108         * @return the x-coordinates (must be strictly increasing and match
109         *         {@link #getY()})
110         */
111        double[] getX();
112
113        /**
114         * The dependent coordinate values used to fit the LOESS model.
115         *
116         * @return the y-coordinates corresponding to {@link #getX()}
117         */
118        double[] getY();
119
120        /**
121         * Interpolate the fitted LOESS spline at the supplied point.
122         *
123         * <p>
124         * Values outside the fitted support are clamped to the support boundaries to
125         * avoid extrapolation artefacts.
126         *
127         * @param x the point at which to evaluate the interpolant
128         * @return the interpolated y value
129         */
130        @Override
131        default double interpolate(double x) {
132                x = Interpolator.squish(this.getMinSupport(), x, this.getMaxSupport());
133                return this.getLoess().value(x);
134        }
135
136}
